resources.string: Number of chest compressions between rescue breaths
Duration of the pause for rescue breaths in seconds
Local emergency phone number used when the Pulsar CPR call button is pressed (911,112, 155, ...)

1. "Heart image" blinking with accompanied beeping tells you the optimal frequency of chest compressions.

 2. "Heart counter" restart is a signal for the rescue breaths.

 3. "Call ambulance button" opens a dialogue from which you can start a call to the emergency services.

4. "Reset button" clears the "Heart counter" and the time indicators.

 5. "Start time indicator" shows when the CPR started. It can be cleared by the "Reset button".

 6. "Duration indicator" shows for how long the CPR was performed. It can be cleared by the "Reset button".

7. Setting "Chest compressions per minute" determines the frequency of the "Heart counter" changes and beeps.

 8. Setting "Rescue breath frequency" determines the maximum value of the "Heart counter".

 9. Setting "Ambulance phone number" determines the default emergency number that is used when you use the "Call ambulance button."
